com.kdbp.calendar.data
Class CalDay

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.kdbp.calendar.data.CalDay
public class CalDay
extends Object

Stores all of the appointments of a single calendar day. It also has some useful calendar-related abilities, such as the ability to create a new calendar day that is incremented by a day.

Constructor Summary
CalDay()
          Default constructor Constructs an invalid CalDay object
CalDay(GregorianCalendar cal)
          Constructor Creates a new CalDay which is ready for appointments to be added to it.

Constructor Detail

CalDay

public CalDay()
Default constructor Constructs an invalid CalDay object

CalDay

public CalDay(GregorianCalendar cal)
Constructor Creates a new CalDay which is ready for appointments to be added to it. Note that months are numbered 0 through 11. This does not check to see if a date is valid.
Method Detail

addAppt

public void addAppt(Appt appt)
Adds an appointment to the calendar day object. The appointments are kept in order by start time. Note that this does not check to see if the appointment actually occurs on this day. This is so the recurring appointments can be added. The appointment can also be added twice.

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Returns:
True if this is an initalized CalDay object

iterator

public Iterator iterator()
This returns an iterator of Appt objects for the calendar day. The appointments are added after the CalDay is constructed. The appointments are guaranteed to be in order by time, with appointments with no specific time set placed at the beginning.

getAppts

public LinkedList getAppts()
Gets appts

getDay

public int getDay()
Gets day

getMonth

public int getMonth()
Gets the month represented by this calDay. Note that January-December are represented by 0-11

getYear

public int getYear()
Gets year

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of the date represented in the format of MM/DD/YYYY. If someone where to ask what day of the year this CalDay was for, and they called this method, that would be the answer. No further adjustment would be necessary. Useful for debugging.
Overrides:
toString in class Object
